trans-unit.source: You can help your users be more productive by letting them view multiple independent parts of your app in separate windows.
trans-unit.target: You can help your users be more productive by letting them view multiple independent parts of your app in separate windows.

trans-unit.source: A typical example is an e-mail app where the main UI shows the list of emails and a preview of the selected e-mail.
trans-unit.target: A typical example is an e-mail app where the main UI shows the list of emails and a preview of the selected e-mail.

trans-unit.source: But users can also open messages in separate windows and view them side-by-side.
trans-unit.target: But users can also open messages in separate windows and view them side-by-side.

trans-unit.source: When you create multiple windows for an app, each window behaves independently.
trans-unit.target: When you create multiple windows for an app, each window behaves independently.

trans-unit.source: The taskbar shows each window separately.
trans-unit.target: The taskbar shows each window separately.

trans-unit.source: Users can move, resize, show, and hide app windows independently and can switch between app windows as if they were separate apps.
trans-unit.target: Users can move, resize, show, and hide app windows independently and can switch between app windows as if they were separate apps.

trans-unit.source: Each window operates in its own thread.
trans-unit.target: Each window operates in its own thread.

trans-unit.source: What is a view?
trans-unit.target: What is a view?

trans-unit.source: An app view is the 1:1 pairing of a thread and a window that the app uses to display content.
trans-unit.target: An app view is the 1:1 pairing of a thread and a window that the app uses to display content.

trans-unit.source: It's represented by a [**CoreApplicationView**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225017) object.
trans-unit.target: It's represented by a [**CoreApplicationView**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225017) object.

trans-unit.source: Views are managed by the [**CoreApplication**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225016) object.
trans-unit.target: Views are managed by the [**CoreApplication**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225016) object.

trans-unit.source: You call [**CoreApplication.CreateNewView**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn297278) to create a[**CoreApplicationView**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225017) object.
trans-unit.target: You call [**CoreApplication.CreateNewView**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn297278) to create a[**CoreApplicationView**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225017) object.

trans-unit.source: The **CoreApplicationView** brings together a [**CoreWindow**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br208225) and a [**CoreDispatcher**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br208211) (stored in the [**CoreWindow**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225019) and [**Dispatcher**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn433264) properties).
trans-unit.target: The **CoreApplicationView** brings together a [**CoreWindow**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br208225) and a [**CoreDispatcher**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br208211) (stored in the [**CoreWindow**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225019) and [**Dispatcher**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn433264) properties).

trans-unit.source: You can think of the **CoreApplicationView** as the object that the Windows Runtime uses to interact with the core Windows system.
trans-unit.target: You can think of the **CoreApplicationView** as the object that the Windows Runtime uses to interact with the core Windows system.

trans-unit.source: You typically don’t work directly with the [**CoreApplicationView**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225017).
trans-unit.target: You typically don’t work directly with the [**CoreApplicationView**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225017).

trans-unit.source: Instead, the Windows Runtime provides the [**ApplicationView**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701658) class in the [**Windows.UI.ViewManagement**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242295) namespace.
trans-unit.target: Instead, the Windows Runtime provides the [**ApplicationView**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701658) class in the [**Windows.UI.ViewManagement**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242295) namespace.

trans-unit.source: This class provides properties, methods, and events that you use when your app interacts with the windowing system.
trans-unit.target: This class provides properties, methods, and events that you use when your app interacts with the windowing system.

trans-unit.source: To work with an **ApplicationView**, call the static [**ApplicationView.GetForCurrentView**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701672) method, which gets an **ApplicationView** instance tied to the current **CoreApplicationView**’s thread.
trans-unit.target: To work with an **ApplicationView**, call the static [**ApplicationView.GetForCurrentView**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701672) method, which gets an **ApplicationView** instance tied to the current **CoreApplicationView**’s thread.

trans-unit.source: Likewise, the XAML framework wraps the [**CoreWindow**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br208225) object in a [**Windows.UI.XAML.Window**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209041) object.
trans-unit.target: Likewise, the XAML framework wraps the [**CoreWindow**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br208225) object in a [**Windows.UI.XAML.Window**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209041) object.

trans-unit.source: In a XAML app, you typically interact with the **Window** object rather than working directly with the **CoreWindow**.
trans-unit.target: In a XAML app, you typically interact with the **Window** object rather than working directly with the **CoreWindow**.

trans-unit.source: Show a new view
trans-unit.target: Show a new view

trans-unit.source: Before we go further, let's look at the steps to create a new view.
trans-unit.target: Before we go further, let's look at the steps to create a new view.

trans-unit.source: Here, the new view is launched in response to a button click.
trans-unit.target: Here, the new view is launched in response to a button click.

trans-unit.source: To show a new view
trans-unit.target: To show a new view

trans-unit.source: Call [**CoreApplication.CreateNewView**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn297291) to create a new window and thread for the view content.
trans-unit.target: Call [**CoreApplication.CreateNewView**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn297291) to create a new window and thread for the view content.

trans-unit.source: Track the [**Id**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn281120) of the new view.
trans-unit.target: Track the [**Id**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn281120) of the new view.

trans-unit.source: You use this to show the view later.
trans-unit.target: You use this to show the view later.

trans-unit.source: You might want to consider building some infrastructure into your app to help with tracking the views you create.
trans-unit.target: You might want to consider building some infrastructure into your app to help with tracking the views you create.

trans-unit.source: See the `ViewLifetimeControl` class in the [MultipleViews sample](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=620574) for an example.
trans-unit.target: See the `ViewLifetimeControl` class in the [MultipleViews sample](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=620574) for an example.

trans-unit.source: On the new thread, populate the window.
trans-unit.target: On the new thread, populate the window.

trans-unit.source: You use the [**CoreDispatcher.RunAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh750317) method to schedule work on the UI thread for the new view.
trans-unit.target: You use the [**CoreDispatcher.RunAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh750317) method to schedule work on the UI thread for the new view.

trans-unit.source: You use a [lambda expression](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=389615) to pass a function as an argument to the **RunAsync** method.
trans-unit.target: You use a [lambda expression](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=389615) to pass a function as an argument to the **RunAsync** method.

trans-unit.source: The work you do in the lambda function happens on the new view's thread.
trans-unit.target: The work you do in the lambda function happens on the new view's thread.

trans-unit.source: In XAML, you typically add a [**Frame**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242682) to the [**Window**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209041)'s [**Content**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209051) property, then navigate the **Frame** to a XAML [**Page**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227503) where you've defined your app content.
trans-unit.target: In XAML, you typically add a [**Frame**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242682) to the [**Window**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209041)'s [**Content**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209051) property, then navigate the **Frame** to a XAML [**Page**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227503) where you've defined your app content.

trans-unit.source: For more info, see [Peer-to-peer navigation between two pages](peer-to-peer-navigation-between-two-pages.md).
trans-unit.target: For more info, see [Peer-to-peer navigation between two pages](peer-to-peer-navigation-between-two-pages.md).

trans-unit.source: After the new [**Window**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209041) is populated, you must call the **Window**'s [**Activate**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209046) method in order to show the **Window** later.
trans-unit.target: After the new [**Window**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209041) is populated, you must call the **Window**'s [**Activate**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209046) method in order to show the **Window** later.

trans-unit.source: This work happens on the new view's thread, so the new **Window** is activated.
trans-unit.target: This work happens on the new view's thread, so the new **Window** is activated.

trans-unit.source: Finally, get the new view's [**Id**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn281120) that you use to show the view later.
trans-unit.target: Finally, get the new view's [**Id**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn281120) that you use to show the view later.

trans-unit.source: Again, this work is on the new view's thread, so [**ApplicationView.GetForCurrentView**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701672) gets the **Id** of the new view.
trans-unit.target: Again, this work is on the new view's thread, so [**ApplicationView.GetForCurrentView**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701672) gets the **Id** of the new view.

trans-unit.source: Show the new view by calling [**ApplicationViewSwitcher.TryShowAsStandaloneAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn281101).
trans-unit.target: Show the new view by calling [**ApplicationViewSwitcher.TryShowAsStandaloneAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn281101).

trans-unit.source: After you create a new view, you can show it in a new window by calling the [**ApplicationViewSwitcher.TryShowAsStandaloneAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn281101) method.
trans-unit.target: After you create a new view, you can show it in a new window by calling the [**ApplicationViewSwitcher.TryShowAsStandaloneAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn281101) method.

trans-unit.source: The *viewId* parameter for this method is an integer that uniquely identifies each of the views in your app.
trans-unit.target: The *viewId* parameter for this method is an integer that uniquely identifies each of the views in your app.

trans-unit.source: You retrieve the view [**Id**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn281120) by using either the **ApplicationView.Id** property or the [**ApplicationView.GetApplicationViewIdForWindow**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn281109) method.
trans-unit.target: You retrieve the view [**Id**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn281120) by using either the **ApplicationView.Id** property or the [**ApplicationView.GetApplicationViewIdForWindow**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn281109) method.

trans-unit.source: The main view
trans-unit.target: The main view

trans-unit.source: The first view that’s created when your app starts is called the *main view*.
trans-unit.target: The first view that’s created when your app starts is called the *main view*.

trans-unit.source: This view is stored in the [**CoreApplication.MainView**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700465) property, and its [**IsMain**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700452) property is true.
trans-unit.target: This view is stored in the [**CoreApplication.MainView**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700465) property, and its [**IsMain**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700452) property is true.

trans-unit.source: You don’t create this view; it’s created by the app.
trans-unit.target: You don’t create this view; it’s created by the app.

trans-unit.source: The main view's thread serves as the manager for the app, and all app activation events are delivered on this thread.
trans-unit.target: The main view's thread serves as the manager for the app, and all app activation events are delivered on this thread.

trans-unit.source: If secondary views are open, the main view’s window can be hidden – for example, by clicking the close (x) button in the window title bar - but its thread remains active.
trans-unit.target: If secondary views are open, the main view’s window can be hidden – for example, by clicking the close (x) button in the window title bar - but its thread remains active.

trans-unit.source: Calling [**Close**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209049) on the main view’s [**Window**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209041) causes an **InvalidOperationException** to occur.
trans-unit.target: Calling [**Close**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209049) on the main view’s [**Window**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209041) causes an **InvalidOperationException** to occur.

trans-unit.source: (Use [**Application.Exit**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242327) to close your app.) If the main view’s thread is terminated, the app closes.
trans-unit.target: (Use [**Application.Exit**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242327) to close your app.) If the main view’s thread is terminated, the app closes.

trans-unit.source: Secondary views
trans-unit.target: Secondary views

trans-unit.source: Other views, including all views that you create by calling [**CreateNewView**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn297278) in your app code, are secondary views.
trans-unit.target: Other views, including all views that you create by calling [**CreateNewView**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn297278) in your app code, are secondary views.

trans-unit.source: Both the main view and secondary views are stored in the [**CoreApplication.Views**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br205861) collection.
trans-unit.target: Both the main view and secondary views are stored in the [**CoreApplication.Views**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br205861) collection.

trans-unit.source: Typically, you create secondary views in response to a user action.
trans-unit.target: Typically, you create secondary views in response to a user action.

trans-unit.source: In some instances, the system creates secondary views for your app.
trans-unit.target: In some instances, the system creates secondary views for your app.

trans-unit.source: **Note** You can use the Windows *assigned access* feature to run an app in [kiosk mode](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/mt219050.aspx).
trans-unit.target: **Note** You can use the Windows *assigned access* feature to run an app in [kiosk mode](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/mt219050.aspx).

trans-unit.source: When you do this, the system creates a secondary view to present your app UI above the lock screen.
trans-unit.target: When you do this, the system creates a secondary view to present your app UI above the lock screen.

trans-unit.source: App-created secondary views are not allowed, so if you try to show your own secondary view in kiosk mode, an exception is thrown.
trans-unit.target: App-created secondary views are not allowed, so if you try to show your own secondary view in kiosk mode, an exception is thrown.

trans-unit.source: Switch from one view to another
trans-unit.target: Switch from one view to another

trans-unit.source: You must provide a way for the user to navigate from a secondary window back to the main window.
trans-unit.target: You must provide a way for the user to navigate from a secondary window back to the main window.

trans-unit.source: To do this, use the [**ApplicationViewSwitcher.SwitchAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn281097) method.
trans-unit.target: To do this, use the [**ApplicationViewSwitcher.SwitchAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn281097) method.

trans-unit.source: You call this method from the thread of the window you're switching from and pass the view ID of the window you're switching to.
trans-unit.target: You call this method from the thread of the window you're switching from and pass the view ID of the window you're switching to.

trans-unit.source: When you use [**SwitchAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn281097), you can choose if you want to close the initial window and remove it from the taskbar by specifying the value of [**ApplicationViewSwitchingOptions**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn281105).
trans-unit.target: When you use [**SwitchAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn281097), you can choose if you want to close the initial window and remove it from the taskbar by specifying the value of [**ApplicationViewSwitchingOptions**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn281105).
